definition: lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
(wooden) box/cup/old variant of 緘|缄[jian1]/letter
letters/to close/to seal
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(negative prefix)/not/no
words/speech/to say/to talk

sentences.english: He was always quite dark about that matter.
sentences.chinese: 他对那件事情总是缄口不言。

sentences.english: We kept silent, on the lookout for the large crocodiles that were visible from the rim of the canyon.
sentences.chinese: 看到峡谷边缘的大鳄鱼时，我们都警惕地缄口不言了。

sentences.english: With the opening and dispute, rather than anything.
sentences.chinese: 与其开口又是争执，倒不如缄口不言。

sentences.english: Persephone who knows the whereabouts of the gods were all silence.
sentences.chinese: 那些知道佩尔塞福涅下落的神灵们，全都缄口不言。

sentences.english: If only I had kept my mouth shut.
sentences.chinese: 如果我缄口不言就好了。

sentences.english: We asked him several times, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我们问了他多次，但他缄口不言。

sentences.english: Everyone was sworn to secrecy about what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 大家都发誓对所发生的事缄口不言。

sentences.english: Women would just shut up, period.
sentences.chinese: 女人会刚好在一段时间缄口不言。

sentences.english: Local government officials aren't commenting about the situation.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府官员对这一情况缄口不言。

sentences.english: Beyond that, researchers are generally stumped.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，研究人员大致上“缄口不言”。

definition: (idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
to keep silent (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to keep silent
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to not mention a single word (about sth) (idiom)
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
